Key Match Events: Coby White narrowly missed his first career triple-double, finishing with 23 points, 10 rebounds and nine assists
Torrey Craig scored 18 with five 3-pointers after halftime
Miles Bridges had 31 points, 12 rebounds and eight assists for the Hornets
Bridges connected on a leaning 3-pointer with 2 seconds left to send the game into OT
Patrick Williams knocked down a corner 3 off an assist from Lonzo Ball with 49 seconds left in overtime to push the Chicago lead to seven
Pre-Game Insights: The Ball brothers matchup never materialized. LaMelo missed the game wrist soreness.
Brandon Miller (sprained ankle) also sat for the Hornets.
Zach LaVine (toe soreness) and Ayo Dosunmu (soleus strain) were out for Chicago.
Post-Match Reflections: The Bulls held on to beat the Charlotte Hornets 115-108 in overtime Monday night.
The extra period was all Chicago.
Bulls: Craig didn't play in the first half, but was a huge spark after the break.
Hornets: Guard Tre Mann will miss at least another two weeks with disc irritation.
Miscellaneous Highlights: LaMelo Ball has now missed 116 of Charlotte's last 196 games over the past three seasons.
The Wizards host the Bulls on Wednesday night.
The Hornets visit Detroit on Friday night.
Others: Coby White, Torrey Craig lead the Bulls past the Hornets in overtime, 115-108
Nikola Vucevic added 16 points and 13 rebounds for the Bulls (15-18).
Miles Bridges had 31 points, 12 rebounds and eight assists for the Hornets (7-25), whoâ€™ve lost 16 of 17.
